Easily back up, organize, and manage you.message: Effettua il backup, organizza e gestisci facilmente le tue foto sul tuo server. Immich ti aiuta a navigare, cercare e organizzare foto e video senza compromettere la tua privacy.

Download the Immich app and start backin.message: Scarica l'app Immich e inizia a fare il backup sicuro di foto e video sul tuo server

Self-hosted photo and video management s.message: Soluzione self-hosted per la gestione di foto e video

This project is available under GNU AGPL.message: Questo progetto è disponibile sotto licenza GNU AGPL v3.

Privacy should not be a luxury.message: La privacy non dovrebbe essere un lusso

Welcome to Immich. We are committed to r.message: Benvenuto su Immich. Ci impegniamo a rispettare la tua privacy. Questa Informativa sulla Privacy spiega come raccogliamo, utilizziamo e condividiamo le informazioni quando usi la nostra app Immich.

This Privacy Policy applies to the Immic.message: Questa Informativa sulla Privacy si applica all’app Immich ("noi", "nostro" o "ci") e riguarda la raccolta, l’uso e la divulgazione delle tue informazioni. Non copre siti web, servizi o applicazioni di terzi accessibili tramite la nostra app, né servizi di terzi a cui puoi accedere tramite Immich.

Immich stores all your photos, albums, s.message: Immich salva tutte le tue foto, album e impostazioni direttamente sul tuo dispositivo. Non abbiamo accesso a questi dati né li trasmettiamo o memorizziamo sui nostri server.

, we collect the following information f.message: , raccogliamo le seguenti informazioni ai fini del calcolo delle tasse:

Postal code (if the user is from Canada.message: Codice postale (se l’utente proviene da Canada o Stati Uniti)

The country of origin and postal code (f.message: Il paese di origine e il codice postale (per gli utenti di Canada o Stati Uniti) vengono raccolti esclusivamente per determinare le aliquote fiscali applicabili al tuo acquisto.

The purchase information may be shared w.message: Le informazioni sugli acquisti possono essere condivise con le autorità fiscali se richiesto dalla legge.
Le informazioni sugli acquisti possono essere condivise con i fornitori di servizi di pagamento, se necessario.

We may update our Privacy Policy from ti.message: Potremmo aggiornare di tanto in tanto la nostra Informativa sulla Privacy. In caso di modifiche, aggiorneremo la data di "Ultimo aggiornamento" riportata in alto. Invitiamo gli utenti a controllare regolarmente questa pagina per rimanere informati su come proteggiamo i dati personali raccolti.

If you have any questions about this Pri.message: Se hai domande su questa Informativa sulla Privacy, contattaci a

, raccogliamo le seguenti informazioni a.message: , raccogliamo le seguenti informazioni ai fini del calcolo delle tasse:

Codice postale (se l’utente proviene da.message: Codice postale (se l’utente proviene da Canada o Stati Uniti)

Potremmo aggiornare di tanto in tanto la.message: Potremmo aggiornare di tanto in tanto la nostra Informativa sulla Privacy. First commit on GitHub, Immich is born..message: Primo commit su GitHub, Immich nasce.

A list of future plans and goals, as wel.message: Un elenco di piani e obiettivi futuri, così come dei traguardi e risultati passati.

The setTimeout method in JavaScript is c.message: The setTimeout method in JavaScript is cursed when used with small values because the implementation may or may not actually wait the specified time.

The USER keyword in PostgreSQL is cursed.message: The USER keyword in PostgreSQL is cursed because you can select from it like a table, which leads to confusion if you have a table name user as well.

PostgreSQL RESET is cursed because it is.message: PostgreSQL RESET is cursed because it is impossible to RESET a PostgreSQL extension parameter if the extension has been uninstalled.

Zitadel is cursed because its custom scr.message: Zitadel is cursed because its custom scripting feature is executed with a JS engine that doesn't support regex named capture groups.

Microsoft Entra supports PKCE, but doesn.message: Microsoft Entra supports PKCE, but doesn't include it in its OpenID discovery document. This leads to clients thinking PKCE isn't available.

Image dimensions in EXIF metadata are cu.message: Image dimensions in EXIF metadata are cursed

The dimensions in EXIF metadata can be d.message: The dimensions in EXIF metadata can be different from the actual dimensions of the image, causing issues with cropping and resizing.

YAML whitespaces are often handled in un.message: YAML whitespaces are often handled in unintuitive ways.

Hidden files in Windows are cursed.message: Hidden files in Windows are cursed

Hidden files in Windows cannot be opened.message: Hidden files in Windows cannot be opened with the "w" flag. That, combined with SMB option "hide dot files" leads to a lot of confusion.

Carriage returns in bash scripts are cur.message: Carriage returns in bash scripts are cursed

Git can be configured to automatically c.message: Git can be configured to automatically convert LF to CRLF on checkout and CRLF breaks bash scripts.

Fetch inside Cloudflare Workers is curse.message: Fetch inside Cloudflare Workers is cursed

Fetch requests in Cloudflare Workers use.message: Fetch requests in Cloudflare Workers use http by default, even if you explicitly specify https, which can often cause redirect loops.

GPS sharing on mobile is cursed.message: GPS sharing on mobile is cursed

Some phones will silently strip GPS data.message: Some phones will silently strip GPS data from images when apps without location permission try to access them.

PostgreSQL does everything in a transact.message: PostgreSQL does everything in a transaction, including NOTIFY. This means using the socket.io postgres-adapter writes to WAL every 5 seconds.

npm scripts make a http call to the npm.message: npm scripts make a http call to the npm registry each time they run, which means they are a terrible way to execute a health check.

There is a user in the JavaScript commun.message: There is a user in the JavaScript community who goes around adding "backwards compatibility" to projects. They do this by adding 50 extra package dependencies to your project, which are maintained by them.

The bcrypt implementation only uses the.message: The bcrypt implementation only uses the first 72 bytes of a string. Any characters after that are ignored.

JavaScript date objects are 1 indexed fo.message: JavaScript date objects are 1 indexed for years and days, but 0 indexed for months.

Prior to Node.js v20.8 using --experimen.message: Prior to Node.js v20.8 using --experimental-vm-modules in a CommonJS project that imported an ES module that imported a CommonJS modules would create a segfault and crash Node.js

Some web features like the clipboard API.message: Some web features like the clipboard API only work in "secure contexts" (ie. https or localhost)

The remove implementation in TypeORM mut.message: The remove implementation in TypeORM mutates the input, deleting the id property from the original object.

Things we wish we didn't know.message: Things we wish we didn't know

Cursed knowledge we have learned as a re.message: Cursed knowledge we have learned as a result of building Immich that we wish we never knew.
